com.google.gwt.gears.offline.client
Class Offline

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.gears.offline.client.Offline

public class Offline
extends java.lang.Object

Provides access to a ManagedResourceStore to allow the application to work offline. In the simplest case, an application developer only needs to invoke getManagedResourceStore() in order to allow the application to run offline. In more complicated scenarios, the developer can choose to use getManifestUrl() to manually create a ManagedResourceStore.

A file named GearsManifest.json located in the root of the public path may be used as an optional template for generating the final manifest. The following substitutions will be made into the template:

  • __VERSION__: An automatically-generated version string. This value will be a hex-encoded MD5 checksum of all of the content in the output directory.
  • __ENTRIES__: A comma-separated list of manifest entries.
  • @filter regex: A pragma that will prevent entries whose partial paths match the given regular expression from being added to the manifest. The @filter expressions may appear at any position in the manifest template.
Example manifest: 
 // This is an example of a custom manifest
 
 // Filter any filenames that contain ".online."
 // @filter .*\.online\..*
 {
  "betaManifestVersion" : 1,
  "version" : "__VERSION__",
  "entries" : [__ENTRIES__]
 }

The com.google.gwt.gears.Offline module must be inherited in order for the automatically-generated manifest to be created during compilation. If you need to debug Offline-related behavior in hosted mode, it will be necessary to run a compile/browse cycle to generate the manifest or to use the -noserver mode of the hosted-mode shell.

Method Detail

getManagedResourceStore

public static ManagedResourceStore getManagedResourceStore()
                                                    throws GearsException
A convenience method to create a ManagedResourceStore that will allow the GWT application to run offline. A call to ManagedResourceStore.checkForUpdate() will have been made to the returned object. Subsequent calls to this function will return the same instance of the ManagedResourceStore.

Returns:
a preconfigured ManagedResourceStore
Throws:
GearsException - if the ManagedResourceStore cannot be configured

getManifestUrl

public static java.lang.String getManifestUrl()
Returns the URL at which the ManagedResourceStore's manifest file can be found. This method can be called by users that wish to manually manage the ManagedResourceStore used by the application.

Returns:
URL of the manifest file
